Cranberry Muffins

Jump to Recipe

Cranberry muffins are a delightful treat that perfectly balance tartness and sweetness, making them an ideal choice for breakfast or as a snack. Bursting with fresh cranberries and infused with zesty orange, these muffins are not only delicious but also packed with nutrients. Whether you're enjoying them fresh out of the oven or saving a few for later, these muffins are sure to impress with their fluffy texture and vibrant flavor. In this recipe, we’ll guide you through each step to create the perfect batch of cranberry muffins that will fill your kitchen with an irresistible aroma. Plus, they’re incredibly easy to make, requiring just a few pantry staples like all-purpose flour, sugar, and eggs. So, roll up your sleeves and get ready to bake a batch of these scrumptious cranberry muffins that are sure to become a family favorite!

Ingredients

all-purpose flour

For a healthier option, you can substitute half of the all-purpose flour with whole wheat flour or almond flour. Make sure to sift the flour to aerate it for a lighter muffin texture.

granulated sugar

You can substitute granulated sugar with brown sugar for a deeper flavor or coconut sugar for a lower glycemic index. If you prefer a sugar-free option, consider using a sugar substitute like stevia, but adjust the quantity according to the product's instructions.

baking powder

Ensure your baking powder is fresh for the best rise. If you run out, you can use 1 teaspoon of baking soda combined with 2 teaspoons of vinegar or lemon juice as a substitute.

salt

Salt enhances the flavors in baked goods; however, if you're watching your sodium intake, you can reduce the amount slightly. Alternatively, consider using sea salt for a different flavor profile.

eggs

If you're looking for a vegan option, substitute one egg with 1/4 cup of applesauce or 1/2 mashed banana. For binding, you can also use a flax egg (1 tablespoon flaxseed meal mixed with 2.5 tablespoons water, let sit for 5 minutes).

milk

You can use any type of milk, including almond milk, oat milk, or soy milk for a dairy-free version. If you're using a non-dairy milk, opt for unsweetened to avoid altering the muffin's sweetness.

vegetable oil

For a healthier alternative, you can substitute vegetable oil with melted coconut oil or applesauce. If using applesauce, reduce the sugar slightly as it adds natural sweetness.

fresh cranberries

If fresh cranberries are not available, you can use frozen cranberries without thawing them first. Dried cranberries can also be used, but they will add more sweetness to the muffins.

orange zest

Orange zest adds a fresh flavor; you can substitute it with lemon zest or another citrus zest for a different twist. If you don't have fresh zest, use a few drops of orange or lemon extract instead.

Cooking Steps

  • Step 1: Preheat the Oven

    Set your oven to 375°F (190°C) to prepare for baking. This ensures that the muffins cook evenly and rise properly.

  • Step 2: Prepare the Muffin Tin

    Line a muffin tin with paper liners or grease it with cooking spray to prevent sticking. This step is crucial for easy removal of the muffins.

  • Step 3: Mix Dry Ingredients

    In a large bowl, whisk together 2 cups of all-purpose flour, 3/4 cup of granulated sugar, 2 teaspoons of baking powder, and 1/2 teaspoon of salt. This mixture forms the base of your muffins.

  • Step 4: Combine Wet Ingredients

    In another bowl, beat 1 large egg, then mix in 1 cup of milk and 1/2 cup of vegetable oil. This adds moisture and richness to the muffins.

  • Step 5: Combine Wet and Dry Ingredients

    Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients. Stir gently until just combined; do not overmix, as this can lead to dense muffins.

  • Step 6: Fold in Cranberries and Orange Zest

    Gently fold in 1 cup of fresh cranberries and 1 tablespoon of orange zest. This adds a burst of tartness and flavor to your muffins.

  • Step 7: Fill the Muffin Tin

    Spoon the batter into the prepared muffin tin, filling each cup about 2/3 full to allow space for rising.

  • Step 8: Bake the Muffins

    Place the muffin tin in the oven and bake for 20-25 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Keep an eye on them to avoid overbaking.

  • Step 9: Cool and Serve

    Let the muffins cool in the tin for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack. This helps them set and makes them easier to remove.

Frequently Asked Questions

What is the best way to measure flour accurately?

To measure flour accurately, use the spoon and level method. Spoon the flour into your measuring cup, then use a straight edge, like a knife, to level it off. Avoid scooping directly with the cup as this can pack the flour and result in using too much.

How do I properly prepare fresh cranberries for baking?

Fresh cranberries should be rinsed under cold water and any stems or bad berries removed. If they are too tart for your taste, you can sprinkle a little sugar on them before folding them into the batter.

What if I don't have orange zest?

If you don't have orange zest, you can substitute with lemon zest for a different but equally delicious flavor. Alternatively, you can omit it altogether if you prefer.

How do I know when my muffins are done baking?

Your muffins are done when a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean or with just a few crumbs attached. They should also be slightly golden on top and spring back when gently pressed.

What should I do if my batter looks too thick?

If your batter appears too thick, you can add a little more milk, one tablespoon at a time, until you reach the desired consistency. The batter should be thick but still pourable.

How can I prevent my muffins from sticking to the pan?

To prevent sticking, line your muffin tin with paper liners or grease it well with cooking spray or butter. Make sure to coat the sides and bottom of each cup.

Is it okay to substitute vegetable oil with another type of oil?

Yes! You can substitute vegetable oil with canola oil, melted coconut oil, or even melted butter. Just keep in mind that different oils may impart subtle flavors.

Can I use frozen cranberries instead of fresh ones?

Absolutely! You can use frozen cranberries directly from the freezer. Just fold them into the batter without thawing, as they will help keep the batter cool.

How do I store my muffins to keep them fresh?

To keep your muffins fresh, store them in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 3 days. For longer storage, you can freeze them in a zip-top bag for up to 3 months.

What are some variations I can try with this muffin recipe?

You can add nuts, such as chopped walnuts or pecans, for added texture. You could also mix in chocolate chips or use different fruits like blueberries or raspberries for a tasty twist.

Additional Information

Dietary Considerations

For a gluten-free option, substitute all-purpose flour with a gluten-free flour blend. To make the muffins dairy-free, use almond milk or oat milk instead of regular milk and replace the vegetable oil with coconut oil or a vegan butter alternative. For a lower sugar option, consider using a sugar substitute or reducing the amount of granulated sugar to 1/2 cup while still maintaining the muffin's texture and flavor.

Pairings

Cranberry muffins pair beautifully with breakfast or brunch items such as scrambled eggs, smoked salmon, or a cheese platter featuring creamy brie or sharp cheddar. For beverages, consider serving them with freshly brewed coffee, chai tea, or a glass of orange juice to complement the citrus notes from the orange zest. For a festive touch, pair with sparkling cider or champagne at holiday gatherings.

Serving Suggestions

Serve cranberry muffins warm or at room temperature, allowing the flavors to shine. You can dust them lightly with powdered sugar for an elegant presentation or spread a thin layer of cream cheese or butter on top for added richness. Plating on a wooden board with fresh cranberries or orange slices can enhance the visual appeal, making them perfect for a brunch table or a cozy afternoon tea setting.

Cranberry Muffins

40 min
$8
180 kcal
Difficulty: 20%
Servings: 12

Allergens:

GlutenEggs

Dietary Tags:

Vegetarian

Cuisine:

American

Course:

BreakfastSnack

Tags:

EasyQuickBaked Goods

Description

Deliciously sweet and tart cranberry muffins, perfect for breakfast or a snack!

Ingredients

  • all-purpose flour: 2 cups
  • granulated sugar: 3/4 cup
  • baking powder: 2 teaspoons
  • salt: 1/2 teaspoon
  • eggs: 1 large
  • milk: 1 cup
  • vegetable oil: 1/2 cup
  • fresh cranberries: 1 cup
  • orange zest: 1 tablespoon

Date Created:

11/22/2024
